subject: Parameterized tests by method: a Runner for JUnit 4
msgSnippet: All, I wanted to try out the JUnit 4.0 API, and also try out an idea floated here more than a week ago--that parameterized tests should be based on methods,
messageBody:
All,

I wanted to try out the JUnit 4.0 API, and also try out an idea floated
here more than a week ago--that parameterized tests should be based on
methods, not classes (the way TestNG does). This culminated in the file
pbm.zip, just uploaded to the files section. This allows test classes
that look like this:

@RunWith(ParameterizedByMethod.class)
static public class FibonacciTest {
@DataSource(name="seven") public static Object[] data() {
return new int[][] {{0, 0}, {1, 1}, {2, 1}, {3, 2}, {4, 3},
{5, 5}, {6, 8}};
}

@Test @FromSource("seven") public void test(int expected, int
input) {
assertEquals(expected, fib(input));
}

private int fib(int x) {
return 0;
}
}

The good news: the whole thing took 33 minutes for tests, code, and
refactoring. This gave me a lot of confidence that the new API has
hooks in most of the right places.

The bad news: I'm not thrilled with the kinds of tests it produces. I
encourage anyone who wishes to to pick up the zip file from the files
section and maintain it as an extension, but I won't likely be putting
more time into it.

Thanks,

David Saff
